chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: Charon runs on Linux and Mac OS X. (It may also run on other platforms; the main prerequisite is that Nix runs on your platform.) Installing it requires the following steps:

listitem.para: Install the Nix package manager. You need at least version 1.0. It’s available from the Nix website in binary form for several platforms. Please refer to the installation instruction in the Nix manual for more details.

Obtain the NixOS and Nixpkgs sources and add them to NIX_PATH environment variable so that Charon can find them. The easiest way to do this is to use the NixOS channel, which also ensures that you get pre-built binaries so that your machine doesn’t have to compile everything locally:
$ nix-channel --add http://nixos.org/releases/nixos/channels/nixos-unstable $ export NIX_PATH=/nix/var/nix/profiles/per-user/root/channels/nixos
(You may have to replace root in the last line by your own user name if you’ve installed Nix under another user account.)

Alternatively, you can check out the sources using Git:
$ cd /some/dir $ git clone git://github.com/NixOS/nixos.git $ git clone git://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs.git $ export NIX_PATH=/some/dir
In this case you’ll probably want to do
$ nix-pull http://nixos.org/releases/nixos/channels/nixos-unstable/MANIFEST
to tell Nix to use the pre-built binaries in the nixos-unstable channel.

Install the latest version of Charon. One way to do this is to get Charon’s source from Git and build it:
$ git clone git://github.com/NixOS/charon.git $ cd charon $ nix-env -f . -i charon $ charon --version Charon 0.1
Another way is to install the latest build, e.g.
$ nix-install-package --non-interactive --url http://hydra.nixos.org/build/2662145/nix/pkg/charon-0.1pre225_721cf08-x86_64-linux.nixpkg
